node.title: Most of the world is ahead of Australia. This is what COVID experts from four countries say we could learn
node.alt: A man in a face mask walks past an American flag
node.description: We asked leading experts in four countries — Canada, Singapore, the US and the UK— about "living with COVID". This is what they said.
node.content:
["Across the world, many countries are well ahead of Australia in regards to loosening COVID restrictions, with some \"open\" for more than six months.\u00a0", "Yet Australia is in the midst of a state-by-state pandemic.\u00a0", "NSW, which has 91 per cent of the population over 16 fully vaccinated, lifted its first restrictions five weeks ago and has recorded\u00a0seven-day average COVID case numbers of just above 200.", "Victoria, which has 86.6 per cent fully vaccinated,\u00a0loosened its restrictions in late October and has seen a\u00a0gradual decrease in case numbers since.\u00a0", "Yet\u00a0Western Australia, with no current cases,\u00a0is not expected to open up until late January or early February\u00a0The Northern Territory has extended the lockdown for greater Katherine and is predicted\u00a0to open just weeks before.\u00a0", "Queensland and Tasmania open up next month and South Australia will open its border\u00a0next week.", "Although the low case numbers in NSW\u00a0have surprised many experts, most\u00a0believe a spike in case numbers, at some point, is inevitable.", "Others suggest another wave of COVID-19 infections in Australia could be around the corner.", "So, what is going on in countries well ahead of Australia? And what can we learn?", "We asked leading experts in four countries \u2014\u00a0Canada, Singapore, the US and the UK \u2014\u00a0about \"living with COVID\".", "This is what they said.\u00a0\u00a0", "
The UK
", "In the UK, daily case numbers are hovering around the 40,000 mark, with weekly deaths now averaging over 1,000.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "Boris Johnson's government has faced criticism for its COVID approach\u00a0since\u00a0its so-called\u00a0''freedom day\"\u00a0in July, which included\u00a0the scraping of mask mandates and the end of most\u00a0restrictions.\u00a0", "About 74 per cent of the total population\u00a0is double-vaccinated, ranking it 18th out of the\u00a038 OECD countries.", "Australia is 15th on the list, with 76 per cent of the total population fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "", "
The British government has been widely criticised for its approach since \"freedom day\".\u00a0(Reuters: Toby Melville)
", "Deepti Gurdasani,\u00a0epidemiologist and\u00a0public health researcher at the Queen Mary University of London, said four months after its\u00a0freedom day,\u00a0the \"hindsight hasn't been different from the foresight\" in the UK.\u00a0", "\"And we've seen what's happened since.\"\u00a0", "Professor\u00a0Gurdasani said for Australia, she recommended the vaccination of children and teenagers as soon as possible.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"Lots of transmission happens in schools, and we're seeing this right now in the UK.\"\u00a0", "According to epidemiologist John Edmonds from\u00a0the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine,\u00a0the removal of mask mandates and not vaccinating teenagers before they returned to school were the main \"mistakes\" the UK\u00a0made.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "\"And I think that we should have adopted a more aggressive testing approach \u2014\u00a0using\u00a0lateral flow device\u00a0testing \u2014\u00a0for those returning to work and for contacts of cases,\" Professor Edmonds said.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "\"And I'd encourage Australia to take those\u00a0approaches and encourage working from home as much as possible.\"\u00a0", "
The US
", "Some states in the US have had loosened restrictions\u00a0for more than six months.", "COVID cases are sitting\u00a0at a 7-day moving average of\u00a083,000, with an average of 1,100 deaths a day across the country.\u00a0", "About 69 per cent of the country's population aged over\u00a012\u00a0is fully vaccinated, with a booster program now being rolled out across the country.", "", "
The US sits behind Australia in the percentage of its citizens double-vaccinated.(Reuters: Andrew Kelly)
", "According to Harvard\u00a0University's\u00a0Bill Hanage,\u00a0the US\u00a0 \u2014 like Australia \u2014 is going through a state-by-state pandemic, but in a very different way.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"Poorly vaccinated places have struggled,\" the professor of evolution and epidemiology of infectious disease said.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"[For example] a\u00a0third of all Florida\u2019s pandemic deaths happened since May 2021.\"", "Stanford University\u00a0professor of medicine and health economist\u00a0Jay\u00a0Bhattacharya, who has been critical of blunt lockdowns,\u00a0said the \"biggest tragedy\" had been the\u00a0failure to protect the elderly, who had died\u00a0\"in enormous numbers\" across the country.\u00a0", "He said\u00a0lockdowns led many people to skip essential health services, including cancer screening, elective surgeries, and many other important health priorities. This has also happened\u00a0in Australia,", "As the US enters\u00a0winter, Professor Bhattacharya said\u00a0the health sector was\u00a0\"stretched\" but not \"overwhelmed\" \u2014 yet.\u00a0", "", "
Vaccine mandates have been met with resistance in the US.\u00a0(Supplied: AP)
", "\"I do worry that there may be nurse shortages in places that enforce a vaccine mandate at work,\" he said.", "\"Some have opted to leave the labour force rather than be coerced into vaccination.", "Professor Hanage's advice for Australia was simple:\u00a0\"Don\u2019t think vaccines will make the virus disappear,\" he said.", "\"You will likely have a good summer because of fresh immunity and seasonal factors.", "\"You have other\u00a0'light lift tools' in the locker besides lockdowns, like masks and rapid testing. Be prepared to use them if necessary.\"\u00a0", "Canada", "Canada has had 1.76 million cases of COVID and 29,376 deaths. Over the past seven days, it is averaging 2,373 cases\u00a0and 24 deaths a day.\u00a0", "About 79\u00a0per cent of the entire population is fully vaccinated, making it the sixth most-vaccinated country in the OECD, behind Spain, South Korea, Iceland, Chile and Portugal.", "Canada opened its international border in September, with restriction levels\u00a0varying depending on the province.\u00a0", "", "
Canada opened its border to the US first.(Reuters: Rebecca Cook)
", "Colin Furness, an\u00a0infection control epidemiologist based at the University of Toronto, said Canada\u00a0\u2014 like Australia \u2014 had no\u00a0\"one\u00a0narrative for COVID\", with public health organised and run by its large provinces.\u00a0", "However, he said the one factor he wished all governments would introduce was \"mass use of rapid tests\".\u00a0", "\"They\u2019re not diagnostic tools, but they are absolutely brilliant screening tools,\" Professor Furness said.", "Professor Anne Gatignol, a professor of immunology at the Lady Davis Institute for Medical Research in Montreal, said the \"sanitary pass\" \u2014 known in Australia as the vaccine certificate \u2014 had worked well in Canada.\u00a0", "\"[In\u00a0Montreal]\u00a0when we go to a restaurant we enter only if we have the sanitary pass, we enter and leave with a mask and we remove it only for eating,\" Professor Gatignol said.\u00a0", "\"Tables are separated with plexiglass and gathering is for a maximum of 10 from three\u00a0different households.\"", "", "
Canada has one of the highest vaccination rates in the world.\u00a0(Reuters: Blair Gable)
", "She agreed with Professor Furness on the introduction of rapid self-tests, which she said should be available in pharmacies.", "\"[Overall my advice to Australia would be to] open everything gradually and monitor the cases very closely to avoid clusters to expand,\" she said.", "\"Make rapid tests easily available. Be ready to re-install stronger restrictions if necessary and inform the population about it.\"\u00a0", "Singapore", "Singapore is going through its most challenging period of the pandemic.", "With one of the highest vaccination rates in the world, the tiny\u00a0island nation\u00a0had planned for a phased reopening once 80 per cent of the eligible population\u00a0were\u00a0fully dosed.", "But over the past two months, it has faced its steepest curve of infections and deaths of the pandemic so far, with daily case numbers rising to a seven-day average of about 2,700 and 13 deaths a day.\u00a0", "Professor Yik-Ying Teo, Dean of the Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health at the National University of Singapore, said despite the number tracking lower in Victoria and NSW, Australian states \"must\u00a0prepare\" for a\u00a0rise in infection numbers.", "\"And with the surge in infections, there will be an increase in the demand for hospital resources,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"And I'd encourage [the Australian government] to communicate to the public that vaccinations alone will not be sufficient.", "\"Natural infections will be needed to complement the protection from the vaccines, which means there will be an increase in the number of infections [and] of people who will be hospitalised.\"", "", "
After a month of tighter restrictions after case numbers rose, Singapore is now\u00a0relaxing most rules.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Edgar Su)
", "Professor Tikki Pang, a microbiologist and former WHO director of research policy for infectious disease clusters,\u00a0said there needed to be a continued focus on hospitalisations\u00a0and deaths in Australia \u2014\u00a0not case numbers.", "He said Australia needed to \"continue to be prepared\".\u00a0", "\"Continue monitoring and\u00a0surveillance, especially for the\u00a0appearance of variants,\" said Professor Pang, now based at the National University of Singapore.", "\"Maintain and\u00a0enforce proven public health measures and\u00a0targeted testing [and] keep an eye on the\u00a0availability of new treatments.\"", "", "
WA's COVID-19 reopening roadmap
"]
